intro: Exostyles amazonica, commonly known as the Amazonian exostyle, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that bloom in clusters, often in shades of red and yellow. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, with a rough texture. Exostyles amazonica thrives in humid, shaded environments and plays a role in the ecological balance of its habitat.
